editor.title: Relic Editor
editor.curSubEffDesc: Every 4 relic upgrades, you get a substat roll. Roll Value calculates how high the substat rolled as a percentage.
editor.maxSubEffDesc: The Maximum Substats Roll Value of an relic calculates the RV if the remaining upgrades rolled their maximum values.

error.noOverRoll: Substat cannot be rolled more than {{value}} times.

editor.clearPrompt: There is a relic being edited. Are you sure you want to clear the editor?

info.title: Relic Editing/Management Guide
info.section1: <0>Substat rolls</0><1>The <1>number of rolls</1> a substat has is shown to the right of the substat, indicated by the number of bars. Also, as the number of rolls increases, the substat becomes brighter. Additionaly, each individual bar becomes more colorful as that roll value increases:<3></3>.</1><2>Substat Roll Value</2><3>The Roll Value (RV) of a substat is a percentage of the current value over the highest potential 5<1></1> value. From the Image, the maximum roll value of HP% is 5.8%. In RV: <3>5.3/5.8 ~ 90%.</3></3><4>Current Roll Value vs. Maximum Roll Value</4><5>When a 5<1></1> has 9 (4 base + 5 additional) total rolls, with each of the rolls having the highest value, that is defined as a 900% RV relic. However, most of the relics are not this lucky. The <3>Current RV</3> of an relic is a percentage over that max value relic. The <5>Maximum RV</5> is the maximum possible RV an relic can achieve, if the remaining relic rolls from upgrades are the hightest possible value.</5>
info.section2: <0>Relic Editor</0><1>A fully featured relic editor, that can accept any 3<1></1> to 5<3></3> Relic. When a substat is entered, the exact roll values will be calculated. It will also make sure that you have the correct number of rolls in the relic according to the level, along with validating other metrics.</1><2>Scan screenshots</2><3>Manual input is not your cup of tea? You can scan in your relics with screenshots! On the Relic Editor, click the <1>Show Me How!</1> button to learn more.</3><4>Automatic Relic Scanner</4><5>If you are playing Genshin on PC, you can download a tool that automatically scans all of your relics for you, and you can then import that data in <1></1> Settings. <3>Click here</3> for a list of scanners that are compatible with SRO.</5><6>Duplicate/Upgrade relic detection</6><7>Did you know SRO can detect if you are adding a <1>duplicate</1> relic that exists in the system? It can also detect if the current relic in editor is an <3>upgrade</3> of an existing relic as well. Once a duplicate/upgrade is detected, a preview will allow you to compare the two relics in question(See Image).</7>
info.section3: <0>Relic Inventory</0><1>All your relics that you've added to SRO are displayed here. The filters here allow you to further refine your view of your relics. </1><2>Example: Finding Fodder Relics</2><3>By utilizing the relic filter, and the relic RV, you can quickly find relics to feed as food.</3><4>In this example, the filters are set thusly: </4><5><0><0>Limit level to 0-8.</0><1>Unlocked relics in Inventory.</1><2>Removing the contribution of flat HP, flat DEF and Energy Recharge to RV calculations.</2><3>Sorted by Ascending Max Roll Value.</3></0></5><6>This will filter the relic Inventory by the lowest RV relics, for desired substats.</6>

efficiencyFilter.title: Substats to use in Roll Value calculation

buttonHint: Note: the red buttons above only apply to <1>filtered relics</1>
tipsOfTheDay: The maximum RV of a 4-star relic is around 540%.
The maximum RV of an relic will usually decrease as you upgrade. It's perfectly normal!
Substats with "1"s are the hardest to scan in screenshots.
If all your rolls(6) went into a single substat, it will be purple!
Click on "Details" when you are upgrading your relics in game to scan as you upgrade.
You can now upload multiple relic screenshots to scan!
noDupAlert: There are no duplicate relics in your inventory.
cantDeleteLock: Cannot delete relic because it is locked
locationsTooltip: Disable "All Equipped Relics" to filter by specific characters
noArtifacts: Looks like you haven't added any relics yet. If you want, there are <1>automatic scanners</1> that can speed up the import process!
